N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2816.1 - Periodic review of contract performance

State Regulations
(a) The division shall review at periodic
intervals the performance of the company under its contract with the division. The company shall provide, not less than quarterly, reports to facilitate the
evaluation process and other reports that the division may request. The reports
shall include but not be limited to the following items: (1)
progress of activities; (2)
progress in securing funds from other
sources for administrative and planning costs; (3)
a financial report reflecting all
transactions which relate to the performance of the contract; and
(4)
matching funds received to
date. (b) The company
must maintain records which shall be available for inspection and review by the
division during normal business hours. These records shall include but not be
limited to the following: (1)
housing
preservation and community renewal records; (2)
accounting records; and
(3)
time records of all employees and
consultants receiving salaries, wages or compensation. (c) (1)

Should the division's review of the company indicate unsatisfactory performance
in any of the following areas: (i) carrying
out its proposed activities; (ii)
implementing its financial plan; (iii)
providing financial reports or meeting
other administrative requirements; or
(iv)
meeting its matching fund
requirements; (2)

Then
the division may impose one or more of the following actions: (i) withhold the release of funds; (ii)
place the company on probation; or
(iii)
modify or terminate the
contract. (d) If the commissioner, in his sole discretion, determines that there has been
substantial noncompliance or other breach of contract, and such condition is
not cured or remedied to the satisfaction of the commissioner within 30 days'
notice to the company of such finding, the commissioner shall have the right to
terminate or modify the contract, or take such appropriate action as he deems
necessary as a result of such failure to cure or remedy. (e) The company shall refrain from engaging
in any activities promoting any political candidate or party. Notes
